description:
People Ops is always looking to make the experience of work better and more meaningful for Googlers. But innovating (and operating!) is increasingly complex when Googlers work in more than 50 countries, each with its own unique practices and regulations. The Diversity, Integrity & Governance team works to make sure we not only do what’s required by law, but that we continue to raise the bar and do what’s right for Googlers all over the globe. From supporting LGBT rights to extending parental leave benefits, we aspire to do the right thing in every part of the world: to be fair and inclusive, disciplined but not rigid, and consistent but not bureaucratic.

Equity, Diversity, Inclusion and Integrity (EDII) Business Partners operate as trusted advisors, embedded deeply in the business, who consult on the needs of the organization and design relevant solutions. You will work closely with executives, business partners and People Operations partners to provide thought leadership, manage the business relationship, and set and execute on initiatives to help the business make progress to diversity and inclusion goals. You are the face of the EDII team to the business, cascading EDII products and services to the business and identifying your client’s unique needs to effectively customize.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants and analysts, we're the champions of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them" - we bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next great Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of professional experience in the diversity, equity, and inclusion space and/or human capital consulting
  • 2 years of experience working with senior executives in client-facing, consulting role

Preferred qualifications:

  • High racial consciousness with a strong knowledge of social power dynamics, systems of oppression, and ways to dismantle systemic inequities
  • Expertise in drawing meaningful insights from data to create strategy, tell a narrative and operationalize solutions
  • Skilled facilitator, able to navigate tough conversations with a senior audience
  • Proven track record of execution through program management
  • Able to identify and track metrics of success (results and outcome orientation)
  • Proven ability to build relationships and influence key partners; gets results through collaboration
responsibilities:
• Develop and operationalize diversity and inclusion plans that enables clients and businesses to progress on goals. Lead execution of EDII strategy for designated client portfolio.
  • Partner and build strong relationships within the business and across People Operations, particularly People Partners to understand business priorities and needs.
  • Provide subject matter expertise through consulting and using evidence-based best practices to drive results.
  • Support executive communications on EDII topics. Act as diversity leader for assigned business or region.
  • Organize and lead program managers within the business to help execute strategy and tactics (where applicable). Advise Diversity Council/working group (where applicable).
title: Diversity Business Partner
